Description: Methodist Hospital in Houston agreed to pay the United States $9.99 million to settle allegations that it defrauded the federal Medicare program.

The United States reached settlements with five hospitals in Texas, Washington, Oregon and Florida to pay $4.9 million for the alleged billing of Medicare for medical procedures involving unapproved experimental cardiac devices in violation of the False Claims Act.

Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office of Inspector General
Notes: Source document obtained through a Freedom of Information Act request to the agency.

Info Source: Division of Workers' Compensation Announces September Enforcement Actions, Targeted News Service, October 21, 2010 (via Nexis).
Texas Workers' Comp Enforcements for February Include $40K in Fines, Insurance Journal, March 10, 2011 (via Nexis).
